name: Audacity
description: Sound recording and post-processing. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: LMMS
description: Complete music workstation. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: Cygwin
description: Unix-like environment for Windows, providing access to a number of tools commonly found on Linux systems. (GNU GPLv3)

name: PuTTY
description: Remote terminal emulator that connects over SSH, Telnet, SCP, and rlogin protocols as well as raw socket connections. (MIT)

name: ranger
description: Minimal, lightweight, and aesthetically pleasing file explorer for GNU/Linux. It runs in the terminal window, so it fits in well with window managers such as i3. vi key bindings allow for quick operations to be performed, including rename and delete. (GNU GPLv3)

name: Mail-in-a-Box
description: Easy-to-deploy mail server package for cloud computers. (CC0)

name: ProtonMail
description: Secure web-based email service. (MIT)

name: 7-Zip
description: File archiver for creating and opening compressed files. (GNU LGPLv2.1+)

name: FileZilla
description: Universal FTP solution. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: qBittorrent
description: Easy to use BitTorrent client. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: Blender
description: 3D creation suite for modeling, simulation, and animation. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: GIMP
description: Image manipulation software. (GNU GPLv3)

name: Inkscape
description: Professional vector graphics editor for all platforms. (GNU GPL)

name: Pinta
description: Gtk# clone of Paint.NET. (MIT)

name: Piskel
description: Online sprite editor. (Apache License 2.0)

name: Eclipse
description: Integrated development environment for Java and more. (EPL)

name: LibreOffice
description: Office suite with word processor, spreadsheet, and presentation programs. (MPLv2)

name: Sumatra PDF
description: Document reader with support for many formats. (GNU GPLv3)

name: Zathura
description: Highly customizable and functional document viewer. It provides a minimalistic and space saving interface as well as an easy usage that mainly focuses on keyboard interaction. (Custom)

name: Arch Linux
description: Lightweight and flexible Linux distribution. (License)

name: lubuntu
description: Minimal version of Ubuntu running the LXDE desktop environment. (See Ubuntu licensing)

name: Ubuntu
description: Debian-based operating system for personal computers and servers. (License)

name: Xubuntu
description: Lightweight version of Ubuntu running the Xfce desktop environment. (See Ubuntu licensing)

name: Electrum
description: Lightweight Bitcoin client that provides wallet recovery, decentralized servers, and offline storage. (MIT)

name: DocEar
description: Literature management using mind mapping technology. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: JabRef
description: Manages references and attached PDFs using BibTeX/BibLaTeX. Includes support for LibreOffice. (MIT)

name: OBS Studio
description: Screen recorder and video streaming application for all platforms. (GNU GPLv2)

name: SimpleScreenRecorder
description: Highly customisable GUI screencasting program. (GNU GPLv3)

name: Atom
description: Hackable text and source code editor. (MIT)

name: Emacs
description: An extensible, customizable, free/libre text editor â€” and more. (GNU GPL)

name: GNU nano
description: Simple text editor for the command line. (GNU GPL)

name: Notepad++
description: Extensible text and source code editor. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: PWGen
description: Secure password generator. (GNU GPLv2)

name: Rufus
description: Bootable USB installation media creator. (GNU GPLv3)

name: Wireshark
description: Packet analyzer for network troubleshooting and analysis. (GNU GPLv2)

name: Git
description: Fast, distributed version control providing full project history without the need for a central server. (GNU GPLv2)

name: NewPipe
description: Lightweight YouTube frontend for Android. (GNU GPLv3)

name: VLC
description: Multimedia player that supports a variety of audio and video formats. (GNU GPLv3)

name: youtube-dl
description: Feature-rich command line program to download videos from YouTube and other video sites. (Unlicense)

name: QEMU
description: QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer. (GNU GPLv2)

name: VirtualBox
description: Feature rich virtualization tools with support for many operating systems. (GNU GPLv2)

name: GitLab
description: Web-based Git repository manager with wiki and issue tracking features. (MIT)

name: MediaGoblin
description: Media publishing platform. (GNU AGPLv3)

name: MediaWiki
description: Wiki software that has the ability to organize and serve large amounts of frequently accessed data. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: WordPress
description: Blog publishing platform and content management system. (GNU GPLv2+)

name: Chromium
description: The open-source version of one of the world's most popular web browsers. (BSD license)

name: Firefox
description: Web browser with a large collection of add-ons available. It is backed by Mozilla, a non-profit organization that supports innovation, freedom, and an open Web. (MPL 2.0)

name: Waterfox
description: Fork of Firefox that is focused on performance, 64-bit systems, and data privacy. (MPL 2.0)

name: Apache HTTP Server
description: Secure, efficient, and extensible web server. (Apache License 2.0)

name: lighttpd
description: Optimized for speed-critical environments while remaining standards-compliant, secure and flexible. (Revised BSD license)

name: nginx
description: A HTTP and reverse proxy server, a mail proxy server, and a generic TCP/UDP proxy server. (2-clause BSD-like license)

name: ZeroNet
description: Decentralized websites using Bitcoin cryptography and the BitTorrent network. (GNU GPLv2)

name: Free software
description: Wikipedia entry on the topic of free software.

name: Free Software Directory
description: Over 15,000 free software packages.

name: Free GNU/Linux distributions
description: Entirely free distributions.

name: LibrePlanet
description: Annual conference on free software.

name: Software Freedom Day
description: Annual worldwide celebration of free software with the aim of increasing awareness of free software and its virtues.

name: Digital Freedom Foundation
description: Promotes access to knowledge via technology.

name: Free Software Foundation
description: Nonprofit with a worldwide mission to promote computer user freedom.

description: Site for Free Software Foundation India.

name: FSFLA

description: Home of the GNU/Linux operating system.
